definition: unable to move freely/difficult to get about

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards

sentences.english: Deliver Thanksgiving dinners to housebound people.
sentences.chinese: 给行动不便的人们送上感恩大餐。

sentences.english: He overweights himself with huge muscles.
sentences.chinese: 他肥胖的身躯令他行动不便。

sentences.english: Most patient has the action inconvenience of provisionality.
sentences.chinese: 多数病人有暂时性的行动不便。

sentences.english: Please do not stand at the counter for disabled patients.
sentences.chinese: 请不要站在行动不便患者的专用领药柜台。

sentences.english: Older people's experience of disabling conditions can be affected by the design and layout of their accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 老年人住宅的设计和布局会影响他们行动不便的程度。

sentences.english: They can use the wide gates at the station concourses.
sentences.chinese: 年老及行动不便人士可使用出站大厅区之无障碍闸门。

definition: disabled/handicapped/deformity on a person or animal
old man or woman/the elderly/one's aged parents or grandparents
to attend to the needs of (an invalid, disabled person etc)/caregiver
to injure oneself in a fall
